title: Efficient Multi-Modal Learning for Autonomous Driving
venue: Conference on Neural Information Processing Systems (NeurIPS)
abstract: This paper presents a novel approach to multi-modal learning for autonomous driving systems, integrating visual, LiDAR, and radar data for improved perception and decision-making.
content: This paper presents a novel approach to multi-modal learning for autonomous driving systems, integrating visual, LiDAR, and radar data for improved perception and decision-making. We introduce a new fusion architecture that efficiently combines information from multiple sensors while maintaining real-time performance. Our method demonstrates superior performance in adverse weather conditions and challenging driving scenarios compared to single-modality approaches. Extensive evaluations on both public benchmarks and our newly collected dataset show significant improvements in object detection, tracking, and path planning tasks.
citationFormat: Le, D., Brown, T., Chen, L., & Davis, M. (2024). Efficient Multi-Modal Learning for Autonomous Driving. In Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems 37 (NeurIPS 2024).
